bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Rupert Blue, May 24, 1919

div1.p: Carter requests an extension of his sick leave. He reports that he is able do paper work but not field work.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Rupert Blue, May 24, 1919
div1.opener:
Request for extension of sick leave.
H. R. Carter,
Assistant Surgeon General.
/LC
Baltimore, Md.,
May 24, 1919.
Surgeon General,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Washington, D. C.
Sir:
div1.p:
I would respectfully request extension of sick leave from
May 17th. to June 4th., for the same disability as the previous
ones.

I am able, without detriment to myself, to attend to a cer-
tain amount of paper work--as indeed I have been doing for the
last 14 days,--but cannot do field work, which I would be doing
if well.

I do not think the 4 days--May 17th. to 20th.--during which
I suppose I was on duty need be so counted.

No physicians certificate is enclosed because it is the same
disability for which I submitted them before and I was at the Bu-
reau on the 20th.

I will attend the Conference of the Malaria Committee on
June 5th.
